parameters: <c:0,60,25>I must have left them on the table!
<c:0,60,25>The boss will be so mad if I lose them!
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>\..\..\.. I thought I heard someone yelling, I have to go back.
\af[5]You're not a goblin. What's going on?
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>My name's \N[1]. I'm looking for my friend and trying to get out of here.
\af[5]Get me out of this cell and I can help you find her!
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I\..\..\.. wish I could, the last person I helped swiped the key from me and ran. I can't open the gate.
\af[5]I can get myself out, I just need a bit of help.
\af[5]There's a room back near the entrance to this place. I think they have my wand in there.
\af[5]My name is \N[5]. \|I've long since been cast out of my order.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I've heard of your kind, you can harness the energy of \e['Rivington.Param.worldName']
\af[5]\n<\N[5]>It's true, but not without my wand. Help me get it back and we can both escape.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I think I know the room you're talking about, but there's a huge gate. I'll never get past that.
\af[5]\n<\N[5]>I've seen goblins going in and out of the room behind you. I think there might be some way to control the gates.
\af[5]\n<\N[5]>A red headed guy ran in there earler, I thought he would help but he just ran out with a lever handle.
\af[5]\n<\N[5]>You found it! hand it over, and we'll be out in no time!
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I've seen magic like that before.\..\..\. a goblin that goes by the name \e['Rivington.Param.evilName'].
\af[5]\n<\N[5]>\e['Rivington.Param.evilName'], yes. My or... my previous order was aware of \e['Rivington.Param.evilName']. He's very powerful.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Then we should stop him!\| Right after we find \N[2]\..\..\..\. and escape.
\af[5]\n<\N[5]>Alright, then we should get a move on!
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Hmm... that seemed to rattle the goblin.
\af[7]Nice moves! I don't think that guard had a clue.
\af[7]Don't think I didn't notice the slight of hand. My name is \N[7], what's yours?
\af[7]\n<\N[7]>Well \N[1], would you mind bustin' me out?
\af[7]\n<\N[7]>Thanks! I'd love to chat but I think I should probably get going.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Well... that introduction was short lived. Does everyone here learn how to steal?
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Despite my better judgment, I should help her.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>I need to figure out a way to get out of here.
